results.title: Interviews with My Lai veterans
results.creator_credit: Joseph Strick and Laser Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Five American soldiers present their recollections of the events at My Lai, Vietnam on 16th March 1968. During their interviews such matters as the training of soldiers, the strategy of My Lai and the details of the massacre are discussed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.description: Five American soldiers present their recollections of the events at My Lai, Vietnam on 16th March 1968. During their interviews such matters as the training of soldiers, the strategy of My Lai and the details of the massacre are discussed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks, Terry Jennings and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Part 4 of a series on Australian women artists, examining some of their thoughts, struggles, disappointments, and the effect of sexual discrimination and stereotyping.

results.title: Canker at the core
results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks, Terry Jennings and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Part 2 of a series on Australian women artists, examining some of their thoughts, struggles, aspirations, influences and disappointments, and the effect of sexual discrimination and stereotyping. Features the following artists: Barbara Hanrahan, Anne Graham, Jacqueline Hick, Elizabeth Durack, Marian Hardman, Elise Bluman, Joan Brassil, Dora Chapman, Sybil Craig, Grace Cossington-Smith. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels and tertiary level.

results.title: Women artists of Australia. Part 1. Sense and sensibility
results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks, Terry Jennings, Art Gallery of South Australia, Chrysalis Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An analysis of Australian women artists, presenting some of their thoughts, struggles, aspirations, influences and disappointments. Examines the effect of sexual discrimination and stereotyping. Includes interviews with the following artists: Elise Bluman, Vicki Varvaressos, Julie Millowick, Inge King, Lesley Dumbrell, Penny Smith, Kate Briscoe, Sandra leveson, Leah MacKinnon, Jacqueline Hick, Margaret Dodd, Rinske Car, Micky Allan, Nora Heysen, Barbara Hanrahan and Anne Newmarch.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Scott Hicks, Terry Jennings, Art Gallery of South Australia, Chrysalis Films and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Jacob: 'Everybody's allowed to cry'
results.creator_credit: Lyn Bugden, Australian Film Commission and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A moving documentation of the life of a small boy about to face his sixth major operation in six years. Raises questions of care for the hospitalised, the rights of the patient and family, and the emotional requirements of people reliant on technology for life support. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lyn Bugden, Australian Film Commission and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Thailand: three village children
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Compares the lives of three children in Thailand, their family situation, their schooling and the work they have to do. No other credits available. Suitable for middle-upper Primary School.

results.title: On the river: Thailand
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Shows the lifestyle of one Thai family on a large riverboat in Thailand. Also indicates the role of the river as a highway and the human habitation along the riverside. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Along the road (Thailand)
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows a road built by Australians in Thailand and the ways in which it is used for communication, trading and travel, by farmers, traders, foresters and families. Suitable for middle-upper Primary School. No other credits available.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: The Philippines: talking pictures
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”
Filipino children’s paintings are intercut with live action showing aspects of the Philippines. The children responsible for the art work provide the commentary.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Games: the Philippines
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Shows a variety of games played by Filipino children as well as toys made by them. Includes the indigenous and English names for the games. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
